comment: He is one of the best professors in chemistry. He is willing to help all the students. He drops the lowest test grade. I would definitely recommend him.
How similar are Keller's practice exams to the actual exams?

Dr. Keller was an amazing professor to me! I really felt that I understood everything he taught us even though it was a tough course. Make sure you do the homework which really helps and ask questions because he will not make you feel stupid. I can honestly say at the end I did not like him though because he did not give me ONE extra point.

Dr Keller is great. He explains calculations on the board, & his tests are multiple choice. This is a hard class so you have to be willing to do the work. The OWL hw helps keep your grade up & he drops the lowest test grade. He also gives random extra credit so it's smart to go to class even though it's not mandatory. I'm taking him for 1212

Dr.Keller is a good professor! Chemistry is difficult but if you just do your homework and go over the text book, you will do fine. He gives you many opportunities to make a good grade. Cant enforce how much you should do your homework!!! Make sure to go to class for the random days he gives extra credit. Buy the $18 study guide for the final!

If you show up to his class and do all the online homework you will do fine in his class. he posts practice test. and gives bonus points if you show up to class. the homework count as a test grade at the end. and he drops lowest test grade. he is very willing to help you

Prof.Keller is a really nice person but I wouldn't recommend him. He is really bad at explaining things. He makes problems seem harder than they really are. He gives extra credit points if show up to class and he also curves most of his tests which are impossible!! Overall don't take him if your not good at chemistry.
Dr.Keller is so nice. He cares about his students. Just make sure you go to class and do the homework.

I find it funny that the same person that gave Dr. Keller bad reviews also said that they registered for CHEM 1101 (which doesn't exist) and that he is an organic chemist (try physical chemist). Dr. Keller is great! It is just a hard class. Be prepared to work hard and ask questions. He will get you through it :-)

I think Dr.Keller is just fine. I don't absolutely love him or hate him.The problem is people go in thinking the class will be easy. If you put in the work, you will be a good grade. Do the homework it is very helpful for tests and so is the textbook. He's pretty nice since he does extend homework deadlines alot, and is happy to help out when asked

I took him for lab. I recommend you do the same. Favorite teacher thus far. Doesn't grade labs necessarily for precise accuracy, just grades to make sure you did the lab right and understand what you're doing. He is very cool and loves to help you. I made an A in lab with him relatively easily. Take him if at all possible.

Very difficult. He is an organic chemist who is teaching 1101 and it shows. He teaches like everyone already knows what he's talking about. Tests are incredibly difficult. Attending class and doing homework are a MUST. Homework is graded for accuracy and tests are very short and each question is worth ALOT!

He is a great professor, I had him for lab and loved him. He really likes to make sure you understand and will help you if you are struggling. He gives a quiz every class, but he never grades it, he just wants to see what everyone knows. he doesn't grade for accuracy, he just grades to make sure you were doing the lab correctly despite wrong number

I didn't study for my first test under him, or at least I thought I didn't. The myriad of homework problems he threw at us paid off and I got an A. It's boring to study Chemistry, so the homework forces you to study. The tests are always easier than the homework. He uses powerpoints very often, so print the slides and have them ready before class.

Dr. Keller is not a good Chemistry professor at all. I made an A in the class, but that came with studying religiously, attending every class, and getting outside help. There is a homework assignment for every chapter, and they are extremely difficult and most of the stuff isn't covered in class. Do not take him unless it's absolutely necessary.
He is not a good teacher just reads of the power point, tests are not even of the book. Just do not take him.

HE IS HORRIBLE!!!! HE DOESNT KNOW HOW TO TEACH ALL HIS POWERPOINTS ARE COPY PASTE FROM THE TEXTBOOK!! AND WHEN HE DOES SOME PROBLEMS ON THE BOARD HE MAKE 20 MISTAKES BEFORE HE GETS THE RIGHT ANSWER! YOU HAVE HOMEWORK EACH WEEK AND HE PICKS THE HARDEST ONES TO GRADE!!! DONT TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!!!!!

Horrible professor, and I mean HORRIBLE. Homework comes at you nonstop, homework which by the way, you have to learn as you go. Just reads off of the powerpoints, no effort to explain. Makes the most out the textbook, and when I say "makes the most" I mean he basically relies on it to do his job. It's one of those "you teach yourself" classes.
Had him for the chem lab. He is easy to get along with which makes it easier to ask questions. He is a pretty easy teacher as long as you do the work. Really nice guy.

Dr.Keller is no joke. go to class, PAY ATTENTION, READ THE BOOK. you have to work moderatly hard. DO THEY HOMEWORK!!!!!!! doing homework is the best practice for the tests. his tests are fair, if u studied, then there is NO TRICK on his test.

Class was extremely difficult and Dr. Keller is a difficult professor.  GO TO CLASS! He will give a little extra credit if you do.  Also, he knows if you are working hard class and will reward you at the end for it.  READ THE TEXT!!!, go to class, and ask questions.  HW is hard, so do it in groups.  A's are hard to come by but you must WORK for it

If you're looking for a prof who baby steps you, don't take him.he helps you out with bringing up your grade. Homework is mandatory (be thankful), random points for attending class, and drops lowest test grade which is all MC. Most profs base your grade only on exams so be happy he doesn't!

For this class you must READ, attend class (he gives bonus points to students who are still there if students leave) and Study hard. Plan on reading and doing homework 8-10 hours a week.  Almost failed my first class--I have a 3.5. If you go to his office he is very considerate and willing to help but not too helpful.  He is very technical and dry.

READ THE BOOK! The homework is always harder than the tests, which are multiple choice. But there are always those questions that are "exceptions to the rule" on tests. My class average for the last two tests, 55 and 65. He's laid back but hard. And he knows when you miss class so attend all of them!

The notes come straight from the text. He always gives homework and practice exams. He's willing to help outside of class. He doesn't like when people don't show up and will give easy points to those who do. Study.

This professor is not for those students who don't understand the subject. Dr. Keller is laid back in person but in class he has expectations and he expects them to be met or else. This class is not an easy A. Don't expect to get help if you don't attend. Overall, great on a personal level, horrible teacher. Tries to help whenever needed.

If your looking for an easy A don't take this class. If you looking for a class that goes strictly by the book, this is the one for you. The teacher is not very entertaining in class but is laid back and funny about everything else but chemistry. Word of advice, do not expect help if you don't attend class...won't happen!

Okay, honestly.If you need step to step learning. DON"T TAKE HIM. But if you can learn from the book good. Come to his office all the time. Make sure you stalk him. He's really cool and really teaches you when not in class.. Just make sure you come to class everyday. You think he doesn't pay attention but he does.

He really isn't that bad.  I like him and am taking him next semester.  Compared to the others in the department, he is very helpful, always gives homework and practice exams and even random grades your not sure where they came from.  If your lazy and don't come to class you will have a difficult time.  Just do work and you'll get at A or B.

Not really one to interest you in Chemistry. If you love hard core book ish, he's the guy for you.  If you need detailed step by step teaching...find someone else. He's nice, but not creative and doesn't help too much. EXTREMELY MONOTONE. Straight up boring.
